alert.note: Alert for Eastern Orleans; Northwest St. Tammany; Southeast St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 03 at 1:01PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern St. Tammany Parish in southeastern Louisiana and west central Hancock Counties through 130 PM CST... At 101 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lacombe, or 7 miles west of Slidell, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Slidell, Pearl River, Lacombe, Stennis Space Center and Slidell Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana near mile marker 255, and between mile markers 261 and 273. Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 2. Interstate 12 between mile markers 74 and 84. Interstate 59 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CST for southern Mississippi.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Orleans; Northwest St. Tammany; Southeast St. Tammany
